patterns: What are the symptoms of COVID-19?
What should I look out for?
How do I know if I have COVID-19?
responses: Common symptoms of COVID-19 include fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Other symptoms can include body aches, headache, loss of taste or smell, and sore throat. If you think you might have COVID-19, please contact your healthcare provider.

Symptoms of COVID-19 can include fever, cough, and difficulty breathing. Other symptoms can include fatigue, body aches, headache, loss of taste or smell, and sore throat. If you have any of these symptoms, please contact your healthcare provider.

If you have a fever, cough, or difficulty breathing, it could be a sign of COVID-19. Other symptoms can include fatigue, body aches, headache, loss of taste or smell, and sore throat. Please contact your healthcare provider if you have any of these symptoms.

patterns: What should I do to stay healthy?
How can I reduce my risk?
responses: You can help prevent the spread of COVID-19 by practicing good hand hygiene, wearing a mask, and maintaining social distance. You should also avoid large gatherings and stay home if you're feeling unwell.

To prevent the spread of COVID-19, it's important to wash your hands frequently, wear a mask when in public, and stay at least 6 feet away from others. You should also avoid large gatherings and stay home if you're feeling sick.
The best way to prevent COVID-19 is to practice good hand hygiene, wear a mask, and practice social distancing. You should also avoid large gatherings and stay home if you're feeling unwell.

patterns: When will I be eligible for a vaccine?

responses: description : A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract that causes symptoms such as cough, runny nose, and sore throat.
cause:Caused by various viruses, most commonly rhinoviruses.
symptoms: Cough, runny or stuffy nose, sore throat, mild body aches, and low-grade fever.
treatment:Rest, staying hydrated, and taking over-the-counter medications for symptom relief.
prevention:Frequent hand washing, avoiding close contact with infected individuals, and getting vaccinated against the flu.
description:A viral infection of the respiratory tract that can cause severe illness, especially in young children, the elderly, and people with weakened immune systems.
causes:Caused by the influenza virus, which is spread through the air or by touching contaminated surfaces.
symptoms: Fever, cough, sore throat, runny or stuffy nose, body aches, headache, chills, and fatigue.
treatment : Rest, staying hydrated, and taking over-the-counter medications for symptom relief. Antiviral medications may also be prescribed in some cases.
prevention: Getting vaccinated against the flu, frequent hand washing, and avoiding close contact with infected individuals.
description: A bacterial infection of the throat that causes symptoms such as sore throat, fever, and swollen lymph nodes.
causes: Caused by the streptococcus bacteria.
symptoms: Sore throat, fever, swollen lymph nodes, and white patches on the tonsils or throat.
treatment: Antibiotics.
prevention: Frequent hand washing, avoiding close contact with infected individuals, and covering your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing.
